intro: Isoloma pellaeiforme, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branched. Isoloma pellaeiforme is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
